sub_title: Student Assistant at Tilburg University - Fellow at GAIC - Research MSc Student Social and Behavioral Sciences
summary: Hi, my name is Piet! I'm a driven research masters student of Sociology and student assistent at Tilburg University. I hold a BSc in Public Governance (Cum Laude). I have been trained as a generalist and have many broad interests in the fields of public administration, sociology, political science, social psychology and economics. I especially have a passion for human rights, human security, the study of collective trauma, and the study of prejudice.

authors.headline: Student Assistant at Tilburg University - Fellow at GAIC - Research MSc Student Social and Behavioral Sciences

profile_positions.description: Working on the ISSP, as Tilburg University represents the Netherlands, taking over from the Free University of Amsterdam.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description:
As a student assistant for research network GAIC (Globalization, Accessibility, Innovation and Care) I take care of communications, I help international PhD students navigate enrollment at Leiden University Medical Center and Tilburg University and I partake in the peer group "Cultural Entropy In Organizations". I also receive PhD-level research training, specifically on philosophical and methodological issues in qualitative research in the humanities and social sciences.

In addition, I have taken the initiative to give GAIC an online presence, with the aim of increasing the impact of research done within GAIC. For example, I created and manage the following website: https://dish-portal.kiu.ac.ug/gaic/about/

I also take up project-based tasks, such as helping to organize symposia and conferences, or putting together the annual report, designing logos, or creating website content.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description: As a fellow at GAIC, I work on research related to Human Trafficking and Conflict-Related Sexual Violence, Post-Traumatic Growth, LGBTQIA+ issues and Intergenerational Trauma. In doing so, I engage with fields such as International Relations, Sociology, Policy, Technology and Gender.
profile_positions.title: Fellow

company.name: IMPACT: Center against Human Trafficking and Sexual Violence in Conflict (@impctnow)

profile_positions.description: Worked on research for the UN on the nexus between human trafficking (THB) and conflict-related sexual violence (CRSV). Researching the judicial protection of victims.
profile_positions.title: Research Trainee

profile_positions.description: As part of the advisory board I guide the current board in their day-to-day operations.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Board Member

profile_positions.description: As the treasurer of Cicero I am responsible for accounting, finance and marketing, including digital marketing analytics.
profile_positions.title: Treasurer

profile_positions.description: During my internship at BrabantKennis I explored the translation of nationally generated knowledge to provincial policy makers in a systematic manner. In doing so I researched sources (for example plan bureaus, advisory councils and research institutes) and knowledge demand among policy makers, and compose the periodical for distribution.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: As the digital marketing chair I employed my past experience in the field of digital marketing to further LGBTQIA+ advocacy, and grow our community.
profile_positions.title: Digital Marketing Chair

profile_positions.description: Performed a systematic literature review as part of a book chapter on human trafficking for ransom, sometimes refered to as Sinai trafficking, to be published by EEPA (Europe External Programme with Africa).
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description: Taught courses in the area of law, economics and conflict studies.
profile_positions.title: Course Instructor
